talk.utter: One thing to consider is because the Bluesky API is open and the data is public, X and everyone else will train their AI models using data here while giving nothing back.

talk.author: did:plc:cavkvvz3zeuqqkt5jd34fybp
talk.utter: Absolutely correct and that is a problem, but the solution should not be to create isolated networks but to shout loudly enough for clear and fair legal rules. There is a lack of clear rules like the GDPR.

talk.author: did:plc:yuuhrqi6zrr47xrs7l4ylgqs
talk.utter: Agreed but I don't see any regulations being passed in this political climate and the companies training AI have already decided to ignore existing TOS. So, I guess my point was, if you make any data public nowadays, it's going to be ingested. Not ideal but that's where we're at.
